label: Cook Model (Traditional Commerce)
description: Traditional commerce operating model where humans follow predefined recipes (processes) to execute tasks one-by-one. Like a cook preparing dishes sequentially from written recipes, characterized by manual workflows, human bottlenecks, and reactive order fulfillment.
characteristics: Humans follow process recipes step-by-step
Systems are passive ingredients and recipe books (databases, procedures)
Reactive workflows triggered by incoming orders (customer actions)
Sequential preparation with station handoffs
Manual coordination across the kitchen (systems)
Knowledge resides in cook expertise and training
Scaling requires hiring more cooks (proportional headcount growth)
limitations: Human cognitive limits (can only prep 7±2 dishes at once)
Processing speed bottlenecks (hours/days to complete orders)
Availability constraints (shift hours, sick days, turnover)
Consistency issues (every cook interprets recipe differently)
Scalability ceiling (kitchen gets crowded, diminishing returns)

label: Chef Model (Agentic Commerce)
description: AI-native commerce operating model where autonomous agents orchestrate the entire operation like a head chef managing a professional kitchen. Characterized by proactive coordination, parallel execution across stations, and continuous adaptation to real-time conditions.
characteristics: AI agents orchestrate workflows across all stations (capabilities)
Systems are intelligent actors (sous chefs, line cooks, expeditors = agents)
Proactive mise en place triggered by forecasts and patterns
Parallel processing with station coordination
Autonomous orchestration with human head chef governance
Knowledge encoded in systems, standards, and playbooks
Scaling through station replication and menu expansion
capabilities: Consistent execution (every dish to specification, reproducible)
Unlimited parallel processing (all stations operating simultaneously)
Learning and adaptation (optimize based on feedback, seasonality)
Proactive prep and inventory management (predict and prevent stockouts)

label: Transformation Journey (Crawl → Walk → Run)
description: Phased approach to agentic commerce transformation, incrementally shifting from human-driven to AI-native operations while managing risk, building capability, and capturing value.

characteristics: AI provides recommendations, humans decide and execute
100% human-in-the-loop for all decisions
Focus on high-value, low-risk use cases
Build trust and familiarity with AI outputs
Validate accuracy and establish baselines
examples: AI recommends markdowns, humans approve and execute
AI suggests inventory replenishment, planners review and adjust
AI identifies fraud patterns, analysts investigate and decide

phases.focus: Agent-executed workflows with exception-based human oversight
characteristics: AI executes decisions within policy guardrails
Human oversight for exceptions and edge cases
Expand to moderate-risk use cases
Continuous learning and policy refinement
Measure and optimize agent performance
examples: AI auto-executes markdowns within policy bounds, alerts humans for outliers
AI auto-replenishes high-velocity SKUs, humans review slow movers
AI auto-blocks high-confidence fraud, humans review medium-confidence

phases.focus: Fully autonomous agent orchestration with strategic human governance
characteristics: AI autonomously orchestrates end-to-end workflows
Humans focus on strategy, policy, and governance
Include high-risk, high-complexity use cases
Multi-agent collaboration and optimization
Continuous model improvement and expansion
examples: AI fully manages pricing, promotions, and markdowns end-to-end
AI autonomously optimizes supply chain from forecast to delivery
AI orchestrates fraud prevention, detection, and resolution

safetyPath.description: 5-step human-in-the-loop governance framework ensuring safe, controlled transformation
steps: Review (AI decides, human approves before execution)
Monitor (AI executes, human monitors for intervention)
Exception (AI executes autonomously, alerts human for exceptions)
Govern (AI operates fully autonomously, human sets policy)
